Talk_Ready_1007:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>Hmm, my keen reporter instincts say
something is wrong here...
Talk_Search_1003:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Which means it's more likely that
something—or someone—is keeping
them from getting here.
And they have a recipe that Princess
Zelda taught them. Related?<sp:5:0:0> Maybe,
maybe not.
Talk_Search_2006:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I'm waiting here to greet some guests we
were expecting.

<sp:3:0:2:0a01>But it's well past when they said they'd
be arriving. <sp:5:0:0>I'm extremely worried.
Talk_Search_1004:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>As I always say—starting now—leave no
chirps unchecked! No warbles unweighed!<sp:5:1:0>
I'm saying we should look into this!
Talk_Search_2007:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>Hmm. If Agus and the others have <clr:0000>tents<clr:ffff>,
then they'd be totally fine in this weather.

Still, they haven't shown up yet...<sp:5:0:0> I have
a bad feeling about this.
Talk_Search_2008:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Hmm. If Agus and the others have <clr:0000>tents<clr:ffff>,
then maybe they're taking the trip nice
and slow, camping along the way.
Still, they haven't shown up yet...<sp:5:0:0> I have
a bad feeling about this.
Talk_Search_2009:
<clr:0000><sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive><clr:ffff>Maybe they brought tents and decided to
take the trip nice and slow, camping along
the way.
Talk_Search_2010:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>They've always crossed <clr:0000>Owlan Bridge<clr:ffff> in
the past when they were coming here.

I figured if I kept an eye on the bridge,
I'd catch sight of them eventually.
Talk_Report_1002:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Ease_01>Interesting! So the chirps and warbles
were really onto something.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>I'm impressed that Princess Zelda's vast
knowledge includes things I wouldn't
expect, like recipes for dishes.
Talk_Search_2011:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Oh! I didn't notice you there.<sp:5:0:0> Are you
a customer? If you're looking for stable
services, head over to the counter.
Talk_Report_1003:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>A recipe from Princess Zelda perfect for
getting folks into fighting shape! Ah, the
article almost writes itself. <sp:5:0:0>Almost!
Talk_Search_2012:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><clr:0000>Agus and the rest <clr:ffff>were excited to come
share the recipe that Princess Zelda
taught them...
What could have happened to delay them
like this?
Talk_Search_6001:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><sp:1:1:4:9a99193f>First...<sp:5:0:0>urk...<sp:5:0:0> First rule of...cooking...<sp:5:1:0>
Always follow...the recipe...
Talk_Report_1005:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Any luck finding those missing travelers
yet? I just started to scout for them from
the sky when I saw you down here!
You chase down any leads at all?
Talk_Report_1008:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>What? <sp:5:1:0>They were right here, too queasy
to even move? And you helped them get
back on their feet again?
Talk_Cooking_3003:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_01>This... I recognize this flavor! Haha!
This is the recipe <clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff> shared
with us!
Joute! Teli! Endai!<sp:5:0:0> Hurry up and take a
bite of this!
Talk_Cooking_0001:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Oh, thank you for helping us. We were
not doing well at all...

<sp:3:0:2:0701><clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff> taught us how to cook
this dish quite some time ago. We ran
into her once during our travels.
She was full of kindness for us,
despite our group being a little
ragged on the road.
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>But I do remember now that she said we
needed to <clr:0000>follow the recipe exactly<clr:ffff>.
Talk_Cooking_3004:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Ugh! Whose bright idea was it to
substitute <clr:0000>monster parts<clr:ffff> in place of
real <clr:0000>meat<clr:ffff>?!
Talk_Cooking_3005:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>H-hey! You! <sp:5:0:0>Yeah, you! <sp:5:0:0>Can I have that
<clr:0000>meat and rice bowl<clr:ffff>?

Please! <sp:5:0:0>Please! <sp:5:0:0>I need to eat it!
Talk_Cooking_3007:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>That was me. I'm sorry... <sp:5:0:0>I was just
curious what it would taste like.

I thought maybe her recipe would work
well with monster parts.
Talk_Cooking_3008:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The road to gourmet greatness is littered
with stuff you wouldn't think is tasty.<sp:5:0:0>
Gotta expand your palate!
Talk_Cooking_3009:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Now's not the time to sit and figure out
best practices for future dietary exploits!
We've got to get to Riverside Stable!
<sp:3:0:2:0701>We're so late... I'm sure Gotter has been
worrying about us.
Talk_Cooking_3010:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:TalkPositive_00>We really are grateful for your help. Let
me say again, on behalf of everyone,<sp:5:0:0>
thank you.
You don't even know us, <sp:5:0:0>but you
used valuable ingredients to save
us from ourselves.
Here, please take this...
Talk_Cooking_3011:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS_00>We like cooking with the very best raw
meat when we have it!
Talk_Cooking_3012:
<sp:3:0:2:0000>You can use all of that to cook yourself
a meat and rice bowl sometime.

Anyway, we'd better get ready and head
to <clr:0000>Riverside Stable<clr:ffff>, since we planned to
be there...well before now.
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Happy_00>I have to get going. Hopefully we'll run
into each other in the future!
Talk_Ready_1001:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Greeting>I've been hearing some chirps and
warbles from my little birds.

They say some regular guests of this
stable are late to arrive—very late.

<snd:QuestionNormal_01>The chef here, <clr:0000>Gotter<clr:ffff>, was going to meet
with them to learn a new recipe, one that
<clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff> taught them.
Talk_Ready_1002:
<clr:0000><sp:3:0:2:0000>Gotter <clr:ffff>has been over there waiting for the
guests to arrive. He's barely moved this
whole time.
Talk_Ready_1003:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Let's see...


It's not unusual for guests to decide not
to show up, right?<sp:5:0:0> But what if they're
<sp:5:0:0>unable<sp:5:0:0> to?
<clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000>They were coming to share a recipe from Princess
Zelda too. Hmm, that could be part of this.<sp:0:2:2:6400><clr:ffff>

<sp:3:0:2:0700>These chirps and warbles are worth
looking into.
Talk_Cooking_3015:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Ah, it looks like you're carrying quite a lot
already. Well then, have this instead...
Talk_Ready_1004:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>This rain is the perfect setting for a prime
story. My keen reporter instincts won't let
me leave this alone...
Talk_Search_2001:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Something isn't right. <clr:0000>Agus and the rest<clr:ffff>
would have to cross that bridge to get
here, but...
Talk_Ready_1005:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>There's no time to sleep when a mystery
like this is aloft. My keen reporter
instincts won't let me leave this alone...
Talk_Ready_1006:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'd just heard through my little birds that
there was an issue at this stable.

They said some regular visitors to the
stable were well past when they should
have arrived.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>But apparently it was a whole lot of
nothing? The guests arrived safely some
time ago!
The chef here, <clr:0000>Gotter<clr:ffff>, had made an
appointment with the missing guests.

He arranged for them to come and share
a recipe they learned from <clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff>.

My keen reporter instincts made me think
something might have been preventing
them from arriving...
Talk_Search_2003:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>The guests are all gourmets. Their leader,
a chef named <clr:0000>Agus<clr:ffff>, has taught me a lot
about cooking.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>They were all excited to visit, and I was
looking forward to it. They have <clr:0000>a recipe
from Princess Zelda <clr:ffff>to share.
Talk_Search_1001:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hmm... So, the gourmets didn't send word
that they weren't coming.
